did.abstract: One set of construction plans for the Still River CT channel contruction of 1974

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Ruth A. Haas Library
Archives and Special Collections
181 White Street
Danbury, CT 06810
Phone: 203-837-8992
E-mail: stevensb@wcsu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Still River Channel Construction Plans; MS 047; folder number; item number; Publisher

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Still River reaches from Farrington's Pond in Danbury, CT to the Housatonic River and connects Sanford's Pond and Lake Kenosia. A concrete aqueduct was built near the downtown Danbury area in the 1970s. The hat and other industries in the area contributed to a high concentration of mercury in the river; however, efforts have to clean the river and it is currently used for recreational purposes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of one set of plans. Pages that are missing include: pgs 31-38, 40-44, and 72-75. The end of the set includes duplicates of pgs 7-30 (with gaps) and one plan of for a Yonkers, NY flood control project. Some pages include annotations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Includes 1 folder with plans in numerical order.
